alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Elk; Greenwood; Montgomery; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 12:26AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Elk, Wilson, Montgomery, eastern Chautauqua, southwestern Woodson and Greenwood Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1226 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles west of Severy to near Peru. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coffeyville, Independence, Eureka, Neodesha, Fredonia, Cherryvale, Caney, Sedan, Madison, Howard, Dearing, Altoona, Moline, Longton, Elk City, Toronto, Hamilton, Severy, Tyro and Fall River. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central and southeastern Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Chautauqua; Elk; Greenwood; Montgomery; Wilson; Woodson
